src:
Duh! Parkir Liar di Fatmawati Tak Hilang di Akhir Pekan, Ada Truk
03 Nov 2019, 11:32 by Wilda Hayatun Nufus
Jakarta - Parkir liar menjamur di trotoar kawasan Fatmawati, Jakarta Selatan. Di akhir pekan, masih ada kendaraan yang parkir menyerobot hak-hak pejalan kaki. Duh!
Pantauan di Jalan Panglima Polim Raya, Jakarta Selatan, Minggu (3/11/2019), terpantau ada sejumlah mobil yang posisi parkirnya menyerobot trotoar. Bagian belakang mobil tersebut menjorok ke pedestrian. Kendaraan tersebut parkir di depan beberapa ruko.
Di trotoar dekat Stasiun MRT Blok A, ada motor yang parkir di trotoar. Roda motor itu menginjak jalur disabilitas yang ditandai dengan warna kuning.


Foto: Kondisi trotoar di Kawasan Fatmawati (Minggu 3/11/2019) (Wilda Hayatun Nufus/detikcom)

Kondisi serupa ditemukan di Jalan Fatmawati. Truk hingga motor parkir sembarangan di badan trotoar. Akibatnya, fasilitas untuk pejalan kaki jadi terganggu.
Tak ada juru parkir di lokasi-lokasi tersebut. Sementara itu, arus lalu lintas tampak lancar di akhir pekan ini.

(gbr/tor)
text:
Gosh! Wild Parking in Fatmawati is not lost on weekends, there are trucks
Nov 03 2019, 11:32 by Wilda Hayatun Nufus
Jakarta - Illegal parking is mushrooming on the sidewalk in Fatmawati, South Jakarta. On the weekends, there are still vehicles parked that are grabbing pedestrian rights. Gosh!
Monitoring on Jalan Panglima Polim Raya, South Jakarta, Sunday (11/03/2019), a number of cars were observed that parked on the sidewalk. The back of the car jutted into the pedestrian. The vehicle is parked in front of several shop houses.
On the sidewalk near Blok A MRT Station, there is a motorbike parked on the sidewalk. The wheel of the motor is stepping on the disability track which is marked in yellow.


Photo: Condition of sidewalks in Fatmawati Area (Sunday 3/11/2019) (Wilda Hayatun Nufus / detikcom)

Similar conditions were found on Jalan Fatmawati. Trucks to motorcycles parked carelessly on the sidewalk. As a result, facilities for pedestrians are disrupted.
There are no parking attendants at these locations. Meanwhile, the flow of traffic looks smooth this weekend.

(image / tor)
